6.3.1 Development of Indian Maritime University, Uthandi

Indian Maritime University is an engineering university that was developed in a flat
sandy area, which was part of a flood plain on the western side of the Buckingham
Canal and Kovalam Creek at Uthandi. The area had been entirely paved for the
construction of this institute replacing the sand exacerbating flooding through
increased run-off.
